intro: Cichlanthus ferrugineus, commonly known as the rusty cichlanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and features palmate leaves with a rough, hairy texture. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces woody capsules as fruit. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
